existing_features.title: Implement a single-flow, multi-page frontend experience with three main pages (Landing ‚Üí Riddle ‚Üí Final) plus an intermediate page shown only after two failed riddle attempts, with smooth fade transitions between pages and mobile-responsive layout.

Create a consistent soft pink/blush pastel UI aesthetic across all pages: rounded elements, dreamy UI styling, subtle sparkles, floating hearts, and a cohesive handwritten romantic font for headings/notes.

Add an infinite, continuous falling-flowers animation (multiple roses and tulips falling from the top forever like snowfall) as a reusable background effect used on Landing and Riddle; on Final, use a slower falling-roses-only variant.

Build the Landing page with a soft pink gradient background and the falling flowers overlay; center an extremely large, bold, prominent ‚ÄúRICHELLE‚Äù title styled with floral texture/rose-and-tulip look, with a gentle glow and slight bounce animation; include a line below saying exactly ‚ÄúHappy Rose Day üåπ‚Äù; include a cute pink button labeled exactly ‚ÄúContinue üíï‚Äù that navigates to the Riddle page.

Implement the Riddle page using the same falling flowers background and include the riddle text exactly as provided; provide an input field for the answer and validate the primary correct answer as ‚ÄúRICHELLE‚Äù (case-insensitive); allow exactly two attempts total; on each wrong attempt show a cute shake animation on the input/card and display the gentle message exactly ‚Äúhmm‚Ä¶ try again üíó‚Äù; on correct answer, proceed directly to the Final page.

After the second failed riddle attempt, automatically move forward to an Intermediate page (before Final) that has a soft pink background, a centered image upload placeholder for the user's photo (MY photo), the exact text ‚Äúit‚Äôs okay, i‚Äôll get you more diet coke, don‚Äôt stress out üíó‚Äù under it, and a small button labeled exactly ‚Äúcontinue‚Äù that proceeds to the Final page.

Create the Final page with a soft pink background and slower falling roses; center a rounded card containing the exact note text in a cute handwritten font; below the note include a section titled exactly ‚ÄúThis is you üå∑‚Äù with an image upload placeholder for her photo, surrounded by floating hearts.
Add polish interactions: hover-bounce button micro-interactions, a petal cursor trail effect, and smooth animations that remain performant and do not interfere with form input usability.

Add an optional soft romantic instrumental music toggle that allows the user to play/pause background music; default state must not be intrusive (start paused by default) and must respect user interaction requirements for browser audio playback.
Ensure all user-facing strings specified by the user are rendered exactly as provided (including casing, punctuation, and emojis) and are in English.

Add required generated image assets to support the visual design (flowers/petals/sparkles/hearts/floral texture) and render them as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not route images through the backend).

Add a back button on all non-landing pages (Riddle, Intermediate, Final) that navigates the user back to the first page (Landing). The button must use the existing romantic UI style and be placed so it is always accessible (e.g., fixed top-left) without blocking existing controls like the music toggle.

Extend the flow state manager to support returning to the Landing page in a single call (e.g., add a goToLanding action). When returning to Landing via the back button, reset the riddle attempt counter back to 2 so the user can start fresh when they continue again.

Show a permanent fixed image of her on the Riddle page (the second page) alongside the existing riddle UI, without removing or altering the existing riddle text, input, attempts logic, or wrong-answer messaging.

On the Intermediate page (shown after the second failed riddle attempt), replace the current image upload placeholder with a fixed image of the user (your photo) that appears automatically when the user reaches this page due to a wrong answer flow.

Add the two required fixed photo assets to the project as static files and wire them into the Riddle and Intermediate pages, ensuring they are served directly by the frontend (no backend involvement).

Replace the Intermediate page fixed photo asset with the user-uploaded image (49d7e894-8a2d-48b3-a6b0-bf224bc3496a-1.jpg) so that the Intermediate page displays that uploaded photo as the single image.

Remove all AI-generated image usage from the UI everywhere except the Final page last section (the "This is you üå∑" photo upload/preview section). This includes removing the fixed photos on the Riddle and Intermediate pages and removing any image-based decorative assets used for backgrounds/effects/titles.

Preserve the existing flow, copy, and interactivity while removing AI-generated images: do not change navigation steps, riddle attempt logic, wrong-answer messaging, provided strings, music toggle behavior, or back button behavior.
